personal.name: Anthony Limiero
personal.summary: Aerospace engineer with 2.5 years experience developing embedded flight software in C/C++ for spaceflight missions with a focus on creating command validation tools for C&DH handling.
personal.details: US citizen | Eligible for security clearance | Seeking full-time entry level positions | Available January 2025

entries.school: Georgia Institute of Technology, College of Engineering

positions.title: Software Computing System Intern
bullets: Created compiler tool in Scala to generate C++ command validation code for the C&DH subsystem of the MSR lander
Developed automated unit tests with Python for command sequence validation in continuous integration pipelines
Contributed to open-source FSW frameworks FPrime & FPP used across multiple NASA missions for C&DH
Developed in Windows and Linux environments, using Git for version control and cross-team collaboration

positions.title: GT-2 Project Lead & FSW Team Lead
bullets: Managed multi-disciplinary team of engineers in fast-paced CubeSat mission with rapid 1 year development timeline
Directed FSW team in designing telemetry data storage & command routing with multiprocessor RS-485 connections
Served as software team lead by training, recruiting, tasking, managing GitHub, and designing system topologies
Coordinated with JAXA to define requirements and integration protocols and formulate test plan documentation
